AttackerCapabilities: Ability to intercept and modify network traffic
Ability to identify and exploit insecure data handling

SecurityMeasures: JavaScript variable to store user details

Steps.Description: Intercept the register request to analyze the parameters being sent.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the user details are stored in the response and can be manipulated.
StepDetails.Action: Intercept the register request and examine the parameters being sent.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker confirms that the user details are indeed stored in the response.

Steps.Description: Modify the register request parameters to add the 'account[role]=admin' parameter.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that by adding the 'account[role]=admin' parameter, they can gain admin privilege.
StepDetails.Action: Modify the register request parameters to include the 'account[role]=admin' parameter.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully registers with the 'admin' role and gains additional privileges.

Steps.Description: Access the website with the registered account and look for additional admin functionality.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects to find additional admin functionality after gaining admin privileges.
StepDetails.Action: Access the website with the registered account and look for additional admin functionality.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers an additional 'admin' button after logging in.

Steps.Description: Click on the 'admin' button to obtain the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker predicts that clicking on the 'admin' button will provide them with the flag.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the flag.
